d8ScAuG7UzqnbwVeHFM9PQ.text: Bierodrome impressed me on a Saturday afternoon.  When we arrived, it was virtually empty.  As much as I like a quiet environment, it was almost too quiet.  But more people showed up shortly thereafter.  The bar area was equipped with plenty of comfortable seating: numerous plush couches and chairs, booths, tables . . . not like some bars with that one lone couch that everyone's vying for.  The set up of some of the couch/chair seating areas would be particularly good for large groups.  The dining area proper was tucked away to a side corner, so the Bierodrome was definitely more bar-centred than it was restaurant-centred.  I appreciated this, as I came for one thing and one thing only.  Beer.The drinks list mimics that at Belgo Centraal around the corner, so I tried the Mongozo Coconut (yummy), a Hoegaarden (. . . it was a Hoegaarden) and a Floris Chocolate (decidedly foul, but I cannot blame Bierodrome for my poor beer decisions).  Husbatron got an Orval, a Kwak and a Duvel.  I didn't hear any complaints from him, but that might just be because he got a bit drunk on the crazy Belgian ABV, thus compromising any chance of a truly objective critique.Even though I know this place can get really busy on weeknights because of the professional post-office crowd, it was quite relaxed and enjoyable in the middle of the afternoon on the weekend.  As a bonus, if you're not in the mood for a full meal, a small assortment of bar snacks is also on offer.I was somewhat surprised that the location didn't have the industrial vibe of other Belgo locations, but I soon discovered that the WCs on the lower ground floor carried over this theme (a little bit odd, but hey ho).  You see, the ground floor did not; it was rather modern and swank.  As I walked down the stairs, it almost looked like I was walking into their beer cellar, with kegs lining the walls.  Around the corner, the toilet was well equipped, but I couldn't help but dislike the full-size picture of a leggy Belgian model in a babydoll dress on the back of the stall door, smiling at me whilst I minded my own business on the loo, as if saying, 'You're in here for the third time already; maybe it's because you're binge drinking, you cow'.   Yeah, didn't like that.

V8IteAJz7n3fl5d7JQgaBA.text: There is a good value express lunch menu, which although slightly limited, offers an adequate range of choices (i.e. mussels, a vegetarian, salmon, chicken and a beef dish option). I naturally opted for the bowl of Marinière mussels with fries. The mussels were steamed with white wine, garlic, cream, onion and celery, and was satisfying following a slightly longer than anticipated wait. The fries were naturally as crispy as the ones I had whilst in Brussels three years ago. Oh what memories A good selection of beers including various fruit beers makes this a popular watering hole amongst my colleagues.

iUdUw5mOWWu3i5MUrhwySQ.text: This is a smaller branch of Belgo's and seems to be more of a drinking establishment than a restaurant. Not the most ideal place to go to in large groups - expect to be split across a couple of tables if you do. Just one thing to keep in mind when you eat at this place - order mussels, lots of it, relish the sauces and order some good fruit beer to top it all off. Nothing too hard to remember, eh?Both my visits to this branch involved a kilo of mussells each, soaked and doused in Thai Green sauce and complemented by sweet beers such as mango and strawberry beer. Conversation came to a grinding halt both times as hungry friends dug into individual shells to pick out the tender flesh, drink off the sauce as it messily dripped off the shells and discarded the empty shells, only to go again. It is not an easy process, and you do feel like you've earned your meal by the time you make your way through it. But it's well worth the effort. The frites served with the mussels are mostly of the 'meh' variety, better than McD's fries but that's not saying much. I would have preferred a side of bread to soak up the sauces at the bottom of the dish after all the mussels are cleared out. The prices are alright for a centrally located food joint serving up atypical dishes - I expect I'll go again. It's a good spot on Sundays for a quiet-ish lunch.

LFF2xOiqMkO0NBmS5z9T2Q.text: Ask for the manager, an engaging Czech called Tomas; if it's not too busy he will provide you with a fascinating tour through the many different specialist beers they offer  he will also recommend some extraordinarily delicious (but dangerously strong) beer 'cocktails' (try the 'Bush Scaldis' + 'Lindemans Pecheresse', I challenge you not to order another, and another). Leave the car at home though.

i3m-RxcWC7OJFm1K2ssISA.text: It may mask itself with another name but the Bierodrome is just another eatery from the Belgo chain, and that is not a bad thing. So on a fine Friday evening, after having worked my 8 hours in our sweltering office, I headed off here with a few friends. Setting - Nice setting if a little cramped and a bit on the loud side. This is a bar/restaurant so there is music, loud music and this is what knocks off that star. I want to be able to talk while waiting for food, especially if I haven't seen my fellow diners in a while, and this is made difficult due to the over bearing music. Service - We had a very friendly, smiley, cute girl who had just started her first shift so service didn't flow as we had to point out what we wanted from the menu but this is not a bad thing as I am happy to accommodate someone on their first shift. But after orders were made the service was quick and our waitress was always easy to get a hold of so it balances out.Food & Drink - For starters I had to have the mussels. The first time I ever tried mussels was when I went to the Belgo Centraal and so I knew I had to have it this time. The Mussels in white wine sauce were lovely and a must have, the sauce was just divine, truly divine. My mains was meant to be the wild boar sausages with mash but due to the newness of the waitress she got our order wrong and I ended up with the pork and leak sausages. This wasn't a bad thing as it was still a truly delicious meal, though the side of chips I ordered were a bit over cooked, and I would recommend this to someone going to the restaurant. After all the food I still had a little room for dessert and decided on the Strawberry pavlova, which I can't fault. It was the right consistency and had a good helping of fresh strawberries and strawberry sauce with it. One of the main reasons I love this chain of restaurants is due to the huge beer selection and on this day I had a half of raspberry beer which was one of the loveliest things I have ever tasted and a mango beer which was the most refreshing alcoholic drink I have ever had pass my lips. I wish more places had this wide selection of beers. Overall - A very good experience and I will be returning here again for those lovely mussels.

COgo1R1QS1pq7elbNvB4Vw.text: A chain that sells Belgian beer has to be one of the best kinds of chain. However, Bierodrome is a bit mediocre in most aspects apart from its drinks menu, which is pretty decent. The service is a bit rubbish - ask a waiter for anything at your table and you'll be brusquely sent to the bar. The chairs are reasonably comfortable, but the decor isn't anything special. On the whole, if you want to go to drink Belgian beers, you'd do far better to head just up the road to the Dovetail in Farringdon, which has very friendly knowledgeable staff, a very nice authentic decor, and really good, excellent value food.

SpfF56ixDAo8ZgyGcj-Okw.text: If you like beer, then you really should visit Belgo. There are a few branches across London all specialising in fabulous beers including my personal favourite, raspberry beer. I haven't yet tried the food, but I'll be back soon to give it a go.

qwZjZEE-d2NFxJ-qC0PPOA.text: Mixed thoughts on this place. After going there with a couple of work colleagues. We decided to go there on a weeknight for an offer they have on called Beat the clock, which is basically paying the price of the time you order e.g. order at 6 o'clock and pay £6!. As we all got there different times I was the last to order. Having seen the portion of mussels (which I am told were ever so tasty) and chicken I think I expected mine to be a decent size too alas if you want a decent size meal don't order the roast vegetable tartlet with goats cheese and light tomato coulis. Not saying it wasn't tasty - just that it was average and nothing spectacular. The sauce was just like a light and watered down tomato mascarpone. This place was also rather busy and didn't seem overly organised - though it could have just been the night. I am not writing them off the list of places to go after work around the area.

5FLRgXyIm9U_NOZTyLV31A.text: delicious mussels for so cheap since we did the time menu. quick, friendly service, nice interior. if teh fries had been better would've been five stars. i'd definitely come back

WoSZ3d4ldd9cSRMjbpTdwQ.text: I work in Holborn and this is a great choice at lunchtimes. It gets very busy afterwork but is quiet during the day so great for informal business lunches etc. The bar snacks are tasty and you get a good quantity, so normally we order a selection of these. Like the Belgos in Covent Garden, they also have the 'beat the clock' promotion here, where you pay the time you order- so 6pm is £6 etc. As is to be expected by the name, they stock a good selection of beers here, as well as other drinks.

rgInceBBYsNU0_b4d9uhDw.text: An okay bar at best. I used to frequent this place regularly simply because of convenience. Firstly the beers are excellent, it's pretty fun to have a friend pick the weirdest sounding beer for you to drink and working your way through the list; lots of choice and interesting glasses etc. The food I'd characterise as over-priced and under-par. Snacks are fine (fried chorizo in particular) to wash down with the beer but anything else is beyond their capabilities. Staff aren't so friendly or knowledgeable (perhaps because of the heavy turn over). Only choose this place if you like interesting beers.

8eIQGhbvuwKOZ30BIAsfaQ.text: Lovely beer and good food, especially worth a visit for the lunch specials and 'beat the clock' which is a total bargain for this area of London :-)

pAPZtfgSc_iiabcQ5tQQDA.text: When the craving for moules frites strikes, it makes sense to head to a Belgian restaurant for satisfaction. Naturally, one of the first that comes to mind in London is the Belgo chain and, while it may not be the best there is, it is cheap and cheerful and always has space for a group.The Kingsway branch is just around the corner from the Centraal location in Seven Dials. It's not as  cool as its hipster sibling, but then again it's designed to cater to hordes of hungry students from next door LSE. Unfortunately, it seems to have too many hallmarks of a school cafeteria for my liking.We arrived on time for our reservation and had to wait a few minutes for them to wipe down the table. Not a big deal except the table had been empty for a while so why don't they clean faster than that? The four small tables that comprised our table for 8 were also of different heights. While all were suitable, it just looks odd and it strikes me as a better idea to match up 4 tables of the same height rather than two groups of uneven eating surfaces.Naturally, I wanted to get the moules and opted for a kilo pot with the Thai sauce. The mussels were cooked well and almost completely clean of grit which was a shellfish win for Belgo Kingsway. They were a bit small for my liking and I wonder if that's because they are out of season or if Belgo can afford to have low prices by avoiding the premium big shell mussels. But that's a minor issue compared to the lack of flavour in their sauce. When I get Thai, I expect bold green curry flavours, plenty of spice, and smoothness from the coconut milk and lemongrass. What I got was a watery broth with just a hint of sweetness and no spice or full flavour whatsoever. In fact, I think it was mainly butter and water with a touch of coconut milk. Not cool, Belgo, not cool at all.The frites were average and not much to talk about. I think when they represent a key part of your core offering, you need to spend a little time getting the frites right. Hell, McD's can do some decent skinny fries and they only charge a quid for them!The final straw was the unbearable heat of the restaurant. Given it was a relatively warm night (especially for December), there was no reason to crank the heat up. The end result was our group shovelling the food down in order to get out into the cooler air. I'm not one usually to complain but I know this review sounds like a bit of whinge. The main takeaway was that we went in expecting a nice relaxed meal and it ended up being a depressing and quickly ended attempt. At least the company was good! I won't be back and will give Belgo one more chance, but at their Centraal location I think as I couldn't take another sauna experience!

58wiF1stjUHM1v_RTF7H0w.text: Surprised that I didn't like this place better because I LOVE Belgo Centraal. It's the same chain so shouldn't it be the same quality? Au contraire. First off, believe what people tell you when they say the service needs work. We sat down and waited 20 minutes before they even took our drinks order. Oh boy. We were in it for the long haul. Despite it being the place for mussels, I'm not a big mussels fan so I opted for the rotisserie chicken. I've had it before and always enjoy it, but this time around, it came out with the skin burnt... not that appetizing. We asked for ketchup and mayo to go with the chips, they brought out the mayo asap, said the ketchup would come out in a minute and forgot. We had to ask again. The beers are great (can't go wrong with Belgian beer) and the dessert was delicious (had the berry pavlova... mmmm), but this place needs to work on its service. I'll stick with Belgo Centraal, thanks.

Ta7SPPI1S6ICU5Rt1tRqdg.text: Great food, decent price, okay service, but the Belgo in Convent Garden is sooo much nicer!

2r0uEwkiX6jLY7DDKhR4Tg.text: Went there with a small group and had a lovely time! We sat outside as it was a nice evening and that made the experience all the better! Most of us had the mussels, I was feeling adventurous and tried the Thai version which was very tasty! Just spicy enough and well seasoned. They had a wide choice of beers and the waitress knew just what to recommend as I normally only like dark beers, porters and stouts. She recommended a delicious dark beer that I really should have made a note of the brand name but was having too much of a good time to remember! I'd definitely go back!

7quePD4P1iy3nuilCUjCkQ.text: Food was good. The bread is plain. Desserts are really plain......nothing 'belgian' about the crepe/waffle. Service was quite bad.....management needs to make sure that there are enough experienced staff on hand to man the tables on weekends. The staff forgot to place a few of the food orders....which meant having to remind the staff about them 20 mins later. We ended up cancelling the 'forgotten' orders. They stop serving cocktails around 8pm because it apparently took too long to make one and so they couldnt be bothered. One of the waitresses dropped cutlery on me while taking the plate from the table. The main entrance door swings ....so beware you could just get whacked in the face by the glass door if you dont watch out. All in all the experience was quite awful....im never going back!!

uOPCzYtR1C-bwbLuyDxaWA.text: If you're looking for a good pre-theatre meal before a show at the Peacock, I'd definitely recommend Belgo.  They have a happy hour menu - I think it's classic mussels, half roast chicken or pasta and you pay the time you get in.  It's relatively quick so you can get to the theatre without rushing.  I'd recommending making reservations just in case or you'll have to end up at Wasabi's instead.

EbaUV6ea755oqehW8s5jJw.text: This location is mediocre compared to the original - weak service despite being empty and loud obnoxious clientele.

FV5lmoS0bE0L5-kPQQ_vyg.text: Warm goat cheese salad on croutons is heaven.  Mussels are their specialty and super yummy. Not to mention the prices are spectacular!!!  Great service very attentive and cordial. I did not try the beer...but they had a wonderful selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom. Mussels mariniere
Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom. Goat cheese salad
Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom

E8bYg_zXQSQXyKrziczYjA.text: Offering an excellent selection of Belgian beers, great stodgy food menu, excellent chips (served with mayo, of course) The mussels here are delicious.  My company has an office in the UK so I visit at least once a year. love their fresh bread too. if you have to wait, then wait!

DibqOqzVK-iNnngNi7U6DQ.text: I've been coming here since I was a student and lived not far away. No, not an obvious student hangout, but at the time it was styled as a Bierodrome (exactly the same, just more students) and we came for the Belgian beers. Nowadays I tend to come for the mussels, which are consistently good (at all Belgo locations, I find). In particular between 6 and 7pm when they charge you the time (i.e. 6 quid at 6pm) for moules frites. A couple of other dishes are on the special offer menu but gone are the good old days where everything was included. The frites aren't really frites but they're gooood. The beer selection is huge, and expensive, though some of it is so strong you probably save money... It's one of those places where you can sit and eat and drink and then get a bit of a shock when your tab need settling. However, Belgo is Belgo and there isn't anywhere else quite like it (or if there is, please tell me). Why 3 stars? This Belgo doesn't have as nice an atmosphere or setting as Centrale or Upper Street branches. It tends to get inundated with after work drinkers who stand annoyingly in the way by the bar. The soap in the bathroom smells utterly vile.

C5AkJ2EchYShTQl9Pag7YQ.text: Belgo is a safe and easy option.  The mussels are decent, and they have an interesting range of sauces, some of which are a tad overpowering but most of which are great.  The fries are nowhere near as good as they should be from a Belgian place, but who really cares about fries when you have mussels.The rest of the menu is pretty good, if a little un-inspirational.  They have a seriously extensive selection of beers, which is great if you're a fan of Belgian Beers, even if they are on the more expensive end of their range.  Always a bit depressing looking up from an exciting beer menu to see everyone around you drinking bottles you could buy from any other bar in Holborn, but some people are, it seems, just lost causes.The atmosphere in this Belgo is a little lacking - the restaurant area if kind of tucked around the corner by the kitchen, but not with enough of a view into the kitchen to make that a selling point.  There is some vicious air conditioning which seems to have the power to cool a plate of food in thirty seconds flat.  The bar itself is fine, even if they do sometimes feel the need to fill it with TV.But what keeps bringing me back to Belgo is their Beat The Clock deal - get there at 6.15pm, and that's what you pay for your meal.  Love it.  As long as they do that, I'll be there for my mussels.

v5mCVUxtJdkI3uDsB_tY3g.text: After a heavy night of drinking and a late start to the day, we came to Belgo for some chicken, chips, prawns, and mussels! The service was friendly and the food was good and decently priced. I may make this place a ritual for hangover dining!

Sz1UqfS76fzNNhZBTh22FQ.text: Astonishingly cheap lunch menu (incl. mussels!) and express (pre 7pm) dinner menu.Lunches for around 7gbp, and at dinner the express menu is charged in pounds to the time of your order (e.g., 6:30pm = 6.30gbp) - note: this might be weeknights only, not sure.Impressive beer selection.Somewhat awkward service; often will insist on sitting you in the back portion of the restaurant at lunches, which is annoying, as they've nice windows elsewhere.

Rqclq_YTNIaX7WDj8wkDzg.text: FOOD/DIRNK:1.) Spinach cheese musselts - yum, baked, I like how they have such a selection of beers! With the different percentages!! SERVICE:Good. ATMOSPHERE:I like the atmosphere, trendy, contemporary, nice, graphic design is cool,

CLg8_GWswY2QcFxcByqX-Q.text: I went with a group of friends and thought the selection of Belgian beers was really amazing! When they got delayed in bringing drinks over, they were so apologetic and really made up for it by giving drinks for free and by making sure we were happy throughout which was highly appreciated. I will definitely return given the service and the value for money of the venue

_skAA-JCrAxItXh_P_5Dsw.text: I love beer and I love mussels.I don't love the lack of atmosphere!!!I do like this bar/ cafe as its pretty comfortable with the dining area well away from the drinking. It doesn't have the same vibe as Bierodrome in Islington but at least you can talk with your friends while relaxing and enjoying the great beers. More of a discerning crowd but I heard it gets more rowdy during the week. I've only ever been here on weekends and its usually quiet though last Saturday it was busy from the evening right through to my nineth beer :) around 11pm.Another great selection of Belguim's finest in particular the king of beers - De Koninck on tap. Hail to the king!Other notable beers are Affligem, Brugse Zot and Satan Gold (bottle only).The mussels are excellent my favs are Marinière and Florentine but I will try the Mediterranean when I'm next in town.

XBkW-YJjCXj3J-YRx8PrFg.text: This is a smaller and more bar-like version of one of my favourite restaurants, Belgo Centraal.  It serves a great selection of Belgian beers and wines.  If you are a girl, always go for a cherry or raspberry Mort Subite.  You will not be disappointed.  My only issue with this place is that it is a lot smaller, noisier and busier than the more spacious central location.  If you come here on a week day you will have to wait a while for a table, since the bar tends to get taken over by the local work force.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom

IgJ-E3LiJTnD71__evJ12A.text: This place is good for its specialities ie. beer, although the service suffers a little from it being busy - it's very good and friendly when the staff are helping you, but we waited ages for the bill and to have our table cleared as they weren't even looking in our direction. The food however was good quality and good value.

0aHPL9tpM8uN5csu-IL6Bw.text: The express lunch at Belgo is fantastic value for money. £6.95 for moules frites! Or you could get the steak au poivre with frites for a £1 supplement. Or you could get the warm smoked salmon and leek tartlet... or the pork and leek sausages with mash and jus. Or the linguine with plum tomatoes, artichokes, broccoli, asparagus, spinach and pine nuts. Or you can go with my favorite and get the sticky chili and ginger HALF chicken and frites. Again, this is all available for £6.95. Can't beat it with a stick!p.s. don't forget the massive selection of Belgian beers.

jx4ncq1wSzcgabANArvVxg.text: I was here on wednesday with some friends to celebrate the end of the semester. A Belgian recommended. Lots of choice for beer and the food is really good. However the restaurant in underground and you don't have a lot of space to eat when you come with friends.

3Os4J2N5HqXVzgKWygf6hg.text: Best fish dish I had in 4 days of being in London.  I have not gone to Gordon Ramsey's restaurants but have tried many modern British restaurants and ordered fish.  My husband enjoyed the Liege Meatballs as well.  Awesome wait staff and great selection of Belgium beers.  We liked it so much that we returned for dinner.  See pictures of the fish & chips, steamed mussels with chorizo.  Very tasty sauce!  Wish I have another night to try the pork belly-definitely on our next trip back!

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom. Chorizo Moules
Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom. Pan-Fried Roasted Cod
Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom. Broccoli Stems

QucDEnIvCbNJcC84jUJs7g.text: I really like the mussels and the beer at Belgo so I've been to the Belgo Centraal a few times. This time I had the Provencal mussels. The broth was a little bland compared to the one I've had before at Centraal and I was a little disappointed that they'd taken the kimchee moules off the menu but the mussels themselves were still good. Generally the food was decent and my husband and brother in law ordered the bubble waffle which was delicious. The problem came with the service. Generally the service was slow which I could live with but when it came to paying for the bill I tried to use my voucher 'The Restaurant Card' that i'd bought from Perkbox. This was two vouchers that I'd already spent £67.50 for to get £75 of credit. Initially the servers refused to accept the vouchers. They said that they no longer had a deal with The Restaurant Card. However, on Perkbox's website it still says that you can buy this voucher to use at Belgo so maybe they should inform everyone else. The servers pointed out that the expiry date on the vouchers was passed which was true but Perkbox transitioned their website over to a new one which made the dates wrong, the vouchers were supposed to be valid for 24 months. I had an e-mail from Perkbox confirming that the vouchers were not expired. The servers then said they would accept the voucher worth £25 which was odd as that was the 1st voucher I'd bought and it was clear that they just didn't want to accept the £50 voucher. I complained about this, not in a rude manner and the servers eventually discounted both from the bill. However, in bringing the final bill over, they decided to slam it on the table as if we'd insulted them personally. I do like the concept and the food at Belgo but every time I go there we seem to have a bad experience with the service so it's putting me off going back there again.

C_rHaYYucgOEyiELeovQug.text: Made good use of the timeout 10£ offer for mussles and a drink.The mussles are very good hear however as a proud Belgian I have to mention that the fries are not very good.But still a good spot for cheap ish mussles

Jk6Y9AZ54h7lEgjKqzSBzw.text: Great food, great beer, great service. Enough said. We came here twice in one day. Try as many Belgian beers as possible by getting a flight (or 2).

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom. Bubble waffle

je13omDu-r5XwLQFVP74OQ.text: Awful and rude servers.Stood waiting to be served for about 5 minutes. The servers could see I was waiting but continued to ignore me. After waiting what seemed like forever I went to the bar to see if anyone would show me to a table - the blond waitress with the big teeth just looked at me and continued to pour water for someone.After asking her if I should just take a seat, she just turned around and walked off! When she came back, she rather angrily told me "how can I help you?"I just walked out. Awful attitude. No order for seating. No one to greet you. Bad bad bad.

6BwkpNZZdDBB_adcEwSXtA.text: Worst dining experience I have ever had.  The servers were rude and disrespectful.  They brought us the wrong food, didn't apologize, and when we asked about taking it off the check they fought us and then told us to "never come back." Craziest and worst experience I've had at a restaurant.

WxBjlQNZsi8XTvIZLV6t3A.text: There are a few Belgo locations throughout the city but this has to be my favourite. Only partially because I am always near it.This location can be less busy that others during the day, but does get quite crowded during the evenings. The crowd varies, it is close to the major uni's so sometimes it is full of younger students, and other times not. The menu recently changed, which in my opinion was a mistake. I used to LOVE their homemade sausage and mash. They still have Tuesday night Moules night, which is incredible, so all is forgiven. What I really like about this place is all the different Belgium beers - and every beer has its own glass!! My fav is the Quwak, not only is the beer amazing but its served in a glass that looks like a mad scientist test tube.All in all its a great place to stop for lunch in the day, or drinks and dinner at night. I would suggest making reservations if you plan on coming in past 8 as tables go like hot cakes.

7uBcNuv6235Zb-wsxlMDbw.text: When I arrived, there was hardly anyone there. Of the 3 people behind the bar, none greeted me and it took several minutes to order a beer. I decided to try the calamari, not very many and not very good. They had a great selection of beer. Will not return. My bill, 15.75, thankfully the beer was good!

OroY3VK9OdmFtDq4tFhMRw.text: We went to Belgo cafe cause we wanted to try Belgium food. My husband and I were craving for mussels. We ordered mussels provinciale and marinières , pâte , my kids ordered the burger. The pate was not good , very watery And does not taste like a pate. The mussels were ok although very small . On the other hand, The fries were delicious . We had to wait for half an hour to get our order.

y5v_DNQ0zc5ILMpdc3Donw.text: I miss the old Belgos menu. It seems more 'Americanised ', now, with burgers and barbecue sauces, also the menu on the mussels had changed offering a more Asian influence on the pot of mussels menu. to tell you the truth I was confused by the Menu and a little disappointed but what I had, the half Lobster,  was clean fresh and nice enough. The drinks menu with its endless list of beers, soon made me forget my confusion.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom

Y6wI7Wem90vAAoyxzXws8g.text: Came here again on a different trip with a vegetarian. Got a classic mussel preparation and it was fine. Vegetarian thought her food was fine.

zF9Ej-EjQRjDPveXXTGAQw.text: On a busy night, without a reservation they were able to find us a table. Hooray!The staff were great & the food was agreeable & the portions very large.I had mussels, my husband the chicken. Fabulous selection of beer.The restaurant/ bar was VERY noisy. The noisiest place I have ever been. It was difficult to have any conversation. Everyone seemed to be having a grande time.I wish they had take away . . .

uTeg6Ebzr0xDMNnPpz96ng.text: If I could, I'd replace the fries in Belgo's fish & chips with the fries from The Warwick, and keep everything else. Service is very prompt and friendly, food was very good, and my fish was HUGE. I also loved the character of the beer selection here; you can tell they walk the talk when it comes to Belgian beers, and both my boyfriend and I quickly found new beers we both loved. Overall a great stop - it would be "as good as it gets" if it could somehow have The Warwick's fries.

z3CnD6FDL87B2TRSOXrxzw.text: Nice venue, they have quite a big selection of Belgian beers (with traditional glasses of course) including the famous Kwak. But, the beers are a bit on the pricey side. Saying that, I would go back. If you're a fan of mussels, they also serve 'moules et frittes'.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom. Fruli
Photo of Belgo Holborn - London, United Kingdom. Bruges Zot blonde! Yes!

078HD7LnIKyrahbVZVt0KA.text: I've not been to Belgo in a while, as it is a very touristy place, but on this occasion I was pleasantly surprised. While the menu is not very adventurous with the usual suspects, they still do a very good kilo pot of mussels and chips. And at not too bad a price either. Will I go back? Probably not as there's so much more exciting food in London. But if I have tourists or need to choose a place for a good (but safe) meal for a group of people, Belgo is ideal.

A76QIZbfH_uMVcJcyMJJQQ.text: Some friends and I were invited down for a free meal by the restaurant along with many other guests.  The organisation could have been better with long waiting times, seating problems, dodgy barman, food wasn't great, we were asked to leave the table before we had finished our meal.  One of the lady organisers tried to compensate us with free drinks but the damage was done and I don't have a good view of the place.  I would ordinarily go back for the paid meal experience but I really wasn't impressed with the food.

t9uzJnJmVv7EJG4u4W158w.text: Came here with a few friends for an event. There were six of us and we all agreed that the food, service, and beer list was a hit. The reason I can't award the 5th star is because the mussels were just ok. If they matched the outstanding beer selection and service it would be 5 stars all the way. Still, a cool place to go especially if you enjoy Belgium beer and a fun embiance.

cDxuPuno0b3K1rtU5PNPSQ.text: For Central London, Belgo represents surprisingly good value -- in particular the happy hour meal choices from 5 to 7 PM where you pay the price on the clock. A good deal at 7 PM, a stunning deal at 5 PM. Beers are delicious, too.Would not hesitate to return -- for cheaper than the kebab joint down the street you can get a proper meal with a beer.Good stuff.

DOHc5wJYN53ihtUgoY7UTw.text: The £6.95 lunch menu is great value, and while the moules frites weren't outstanding (something about the frites was a little bit off, as other reviewers have said) this is a really great option if you happen to be in the area. I particularly liked the celery in the sauce, which gave it extra flavour and texture. Those of us drinking got lucky because they were trialling a new beer at just £2 extra with the lunch menu. Random point - they also have a really user friendly website. I don't know why 99% of restaurant websites feature pointless graphics that take forever to load, .pdf menus, and the location page about 19 clicks away, but Belgo's is actually designed to help customers!

Hthh-WVam4khUWXWrbygBg.text: Was excited about trying Belgian food since I didn't really know what that is, but I'm not really a fan of this place.  Their menu lacked any appeal and the service was a bit slow when we first sat down, even though the place was pretty empty.  The menu mostly consisted of burgers, roast chicken, and a variety of seafood dishes.  I was mostly unimpressed because I can easily make burgers and roast chicken myself (not that I would or will anytime soon...) but the point is that I really don't want to pay £11 for half a fancy chicken.  There was 5 of us and we all ordered different things, but no one really enjoyed their meal except one person, who got the Poppei Moules platter, which are basically mussles and fries (aka. chips). I got the spinach and creme fraiche tartlett, which was alright but definitely NOT worth £8.  Another one also got a pasta of some sort, off the Express Lunch menu, which he devoured but said it was pretty forgettable.I think I have to get a better idea of what Belgian food actually is before I make any further decisions about it, but I probably won't be doing it here. I thought the entire Belgian diet consisted of chocolate, fries, and waffles.  Who knew there was more?! I found the idea of Express belgian food kind of intriguing, as Belgian food is lacking pretty much everywhere else in the world.  Guess I'll just have to take a trip to Belgium and see for myself what it's really about!
